comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Mechelen (locally pronounced [ˈmɛxələ(n)], French Malines, English traditional name Mechlin) is a Dutch-speaking city and municipality in the province of Antwerp, Flanders, Belgium. The municipality comprises the city of Mechelen proper, some quarters at its outskirts, the hamlets of Nekkerspoel (adjacent) and Battel (a few kilometers away), as well as the villages of Walem, Heffen, Leest, Hombeek, and Muizen. The Dijle flows through the city, hence the term 'Dijlestad' ("City on the river Dijle"). Mechelen lies on the major urban and industrial axis Brussels-Antwerp, about 25 km from each city. This seems to be the Schepenhuis.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: trialsanderrors, thanks for providing the alternate spelling. The Library's official subject heading for the city is Mechelen, so we'll add that to the record.
